@@ -126,0 +126,4 @@ + *

For methods with a {@code MathContext} parameter, if the result + * is inexact but the rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}, an {@code + * ArithmeticException} will be thrown. + * @@ -481,2 +485,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -1553,2 +1555,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -1596,2 +1596,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -2600,2 +2598,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -2628,2 +2624,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -2662,2 +2656,0 @@ - * @throws ArithmeticException if the result is inexact but the - * rounding mode is {@code UNNECESSARY}. @@ -3096,0 +3088,1 @@ + * @throws ArithmeticException if scale overflows. @@ -4927,0 +4920,1 @@ + * @throws ArithmeticException if scale overflows. @@ -4951,0 +4945,1 @@ + * @throws ArithmeticException if scale overflows.
